content:
Great observations!

With your description, I think I can help you identify the mystery bird at your feeder. The combination of a black back, white belly, and a red cap on its head sounds like a likely match for a... (drumroll please)... Red-breasted Nuthatch!

Red-breasted Nuthatches are medium-sized birds with a distinctive black back, white underside, and a reddish-brown cap on their forehead. They're common visitors to backyard feeders, especially during the winter months when natural food sources are scarce.

As for your hike, don't worry if you didn't spot any unfamiliar birds. It's great that you were enjoying the scenery and trails! If you're interested, you could try bringing binoculars on your next hike to get a closer look at any birds you do see. Who knows, you might spot some new species!

By the way, since you mentioned Northern Cardinals and Blue Jays, I'm guessing you're likely in North America, possibly in the eastern or central regions. Am I correct?

Let me know if you have any other questions or if there's anything else I can help you with!
